name: Natural Language Specs Dataset
description: Dataset of natural language test specifications for validation and error analysis. Based on real-world BDD patterns and queeraoke usage.
sources: Research findings on BDD best practices

specs.name: Basic Game Activation
specs.spec:
Given I visit queeraoke.fyi
When I activate the easter egg game (press 'g')
Then the game should be playable
Context: viewport=1280x720, device=desktop

specs.name: Game with Temporal Capture
specs.spec:
Given I visit game.example.com
When I activate the game (press 'g', selector: #game-element)
Then the game should be fun to play
And the score should update over time
Context: fps: 2, duration: 10 seconds, temporal: true

specs.name: Basic Accessibility Check
specs.spec:
Given I visit a website
When the page loads
Then it should be accessible
And contrast should meet WCAG standards

specs.name: Accessibility with Persona
specs.spec:
Given I visit example.com as a visually impaired user
When I navigate the page
Then all interactive elements should be keyboard accessible
And screen reader announcements should be clear

specs.name: Complete User Journey
specs.spec:
Given I visit an e-commerce site
When I browse products
And I add items to cart
And I proceed to checkout
Then the checkout form should be usable
And payment options should be clear

specs.name: Game State Consistency
specs.spec:
Given I play a game
When the game state changes
Then the visual representation should match the internal state
And cleared elements should be visually removed

specs.name: Animation Validation
specs.spec:
Given I visit a page with animations
When I observe the page for 5 seconds
Then animations should be smooth
And the page should remain responsive
Context: fps: 2, duration: 5 seconds

specs.name: Score Range Property
specs.spec: For all screenshots, the validation score should be between 0 and 10

specs.name: State Consistency Property
specs.spec: For all game states, the visual representation should match the internal state

specs.name: Poor Structure (Missing Given/When/Then)
specs.spec: I visit a website and the game should work

specs.name: Technical Language (Anti-pattern)
specs.spec:
Given I visit example.com
When the API endpoint /api/status returns 200
Then the DOM should have proper ARIA attributes
And CSS selectors should match accessibility standards

specs.name: Overly Complex (Too Many Steps)
specs.spec:
Given I visit a website
When I click the first button
And I fill in the first form field
And I click the second button
And I fill in the second form field
And I click the third button
And I fill in the third form field
And I click the fourth button
And I fill in the fourth form field
And I click the submit button
Then the form should be submitted
And I should see a success message
And the page should redirect
And I should be logged in

specs.name: Hardcoded Values (Anti-pattern)
specs.spec:
Given I visit game.example.com
When I play the game
Then the score should be exactly 42
And there should be exactly 10 enemies
And the game should last exactly 60 seconds

specs.name: Dependent Scenarios (Anti-pattern)
specs.spec:
Given I visit example.com
When I complete the previous scenario
And I do the next step
Then the result should match the previous result

specs.name: Queeraoke Real Pattern - Direct Prompt
specs.spec:
CRITICAL VALIDATION: Payment screen must be perfect. Check:
- Payment code is clearly visible
- QR codes are properly rendered and scannable
- Payment links are accessible
- Layout is clean and organized

specs.name: Queeraoke Real Pattern - Goals
specs.spec:
Given I visit queeraoke.fyi
When I activate the game
Then the game should be fun
And the game should be accessible
And the game should have visual consistency

specs.name: News Page Accessibility
specs.spec:
Given I visit a news website
When the page loads
Then headlines should be readable
And images should have alt text
And the layout should be responsive

specs.name: GitHub PR Page
specs.spec:
Given I open a GitHub pull request
When the PR page loads
Then the diff should be visible
And comments should be readable
And the merge button should be accessible

specs.name: Flash Game Testing
specs.spec:
Given I open a flash game website
When the game loads
Then the game should be playable
And the controls should be visible
And the score should be displayed
